meanings.definition: Occurring at irregular intervals; not continuous.
meanings.sent1: The intermittent rain showers made it difficult to plan our picnic.
meanings.sent2: The car's intermittent engine trouble was frustrating for the driver.
meanings.sent3: The intermittent barking of the neighbor's dog kept everyone awake last night.
meanings.sent4: Her intermittent laughter during the serious meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent5: The intermittent flickering of the old street lamp created a spooky atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The intermittent traffic jams delayed our arrival at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The intermittent beeping of the alarm clock woke him up repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: The intermittent popping of popcorn in the microwave sounded like a tiny orchestra.
meanings.sent4: Her intermittent sighs indicated her impatience with the slow service.
meanings.sent5: The intermittent buzzing of the faulty light bulb was driving him crazy.
